definition: to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: I did not bring you animals torn by wild beasts; I bore the loss myself.
sentences.chinese: 被野獸撕裂的，我沒有帶來給你，是我自己賠上。

sentences.english: I will be playing a game to lose, lose life feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我在玩一場必輸的結局，賠上一生的情動。

sentences.english: What good will it be for a man if he gains the whole world, yet forfeits his soul?
sentences.chinese: 人若賺得全世界，賠上自己的生命，有甚麼益處呢？

sentences.english: It’s just the quality of the officials that have cost us it [the match].
sentences.chinese: 判罰的質量讓我們賠上了這場比賽。

sentences.english: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
sentences.chinese: 人就是賺得全世界，賠上自己的生命，有什麼益處呢。

sentences.english: For what shall a man be profited if he gains the whole world, but forfeits his soul-life?
sentences.chinese: 人若賺得全世界，卻賠上自己的魂生命，有什麼益處？

sentences.english: Zhong Tianqi would get me the sapphire on the cost of life.
sentences.chinese: 以前的仲天騏就算賠上性命也會幫我找到那顆藍寶石。

sentences.english: It is unlikely, though, that any bidder will mortgage his future for the sake of a lunch.
sentences.chinese: 但我想，誰也不會爲了一頓午餐賠上自己的未來。

sentences.english: If Milt didn't stop me, I would probably be out of every cent I've ever made.
sentences.chinese: 假如米特沒有阻止我，我可能會賠上所賺的每一分錢。
